IMO enrolmentMode is more suitable here.

nodes.bodyText: no need to add @NonNull with  boolean isSuccess.

We can use the following statment instated of adding a parameter for cours_id.
            minifiedUnit.setCourseId(courseData.getCourse().getId());
no need to add this, as we already have course_id in minifiedUnit
Some times course_id in minifiedUnit so we have to add the statement.
remove courseId after getting data from the unit.
Make a separate method to initialize the courseData.

Replace with the following code otherwise triger tap analytics on setting up the banner instated of button click.
button.setOnClickListener { v ->
                    clickListener.onClick(v)
                    analyticsRegistry.trackPLSCourseDatesShiftButtonTapped(courseID, courseMode, screenName)
                }
IMO this approach is more appropriate as all the parameters are already available to post the event instated of post-event individual for each screen.
why we need to add this boolean.
currently, CourseBannerAPI is made twice due to code flow, so to handle this issue I used this boolean to make calls only once
better to move this event post statment into setupCourseDatesBanner as all the parameters required by this statement are already there.
